title.narrative: QUALITY

description.narrative: Children and young people, especially the most disadvantaged benefit from quality learning and acquire skills to develop to their full potential.

mailing-address.narrative: C/o UNICEF Amman P.O. Box 1551 Amman 11821

sector.narrative: Provision of (formal and non-formal) multiple-levels or alternative pathways of education (including in temporary learning spaces)
Provision of training of school communities e.g. parent teacher associations, school management committees
System strengthening - teacher development, management, and support
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Children and young people, especially the most disadvantaged benefit from quality learning and acquire skills to develop to their full potential.
Number of youth (15-24 years) who implemented social/business entrepreneurship initiatives (disaggregated by sex and age)
Service Delivery - Early learning - ECD facilitators/teachers who received training with funding provided by UNICEF
Service Delivery - Teachers - Primary teachers who received training with funding provided by UNICEF
Number of adolescents, girls and boys, who completed a skills development program[6] (disaggregated by sex and age,)
Service Delivery - Communities - Number of schools that implement school-based management initiatives with UNICEF support
Number of schools that have included life skills and citizenship education in their school plans with UNICEF support
Number of teachers who successfully completed all modules of life skills education training with funding from UNICEF in targeted governorates
System Strengthening - Learning assessment - Learning outcomes are measured in all schools supported by UNICEF with Child Friendly Schools/education or similar models - score (1-4), see guidance
